noun.description: The top or highest part of something, especially one forming a point.
examples: the living room extends right up into the apex of the roof
the apex of his career was when he hoisted aloft the World Cup

verb.description: Reach a high point or climax.
examples: melodic lines build up to the chorus and it apexes at the solo

origin: 1970s: from A dvance P urchase Ex cursion.
